content.raw: As far as I understand the second argument of the `changeInPose` should  be the euler angle representation of the rotation matrix poseOld\_R\_poseNew  \(while currentPose is world\_R\_poseOld and nextPose is world\_R\_poseNext\) . In that case, unless I am missing something, the derivative of the euler  angles are not equal to the angular velocity multiplied by a timestep?
content.html: As far as I understand the second argument of the changeInPose should be the euler angle representation of the rotation matrix poseOld_R_poseNew (while currentPose is world_R_poseOld and nextPose is world_R_poseNext) . In that case, unless I am missing something, the derivative of the euler angles are not equal to the angular velocity multiplied by a timestep?
